content: Demands money to post photos

I used to LOVE this app. My love has waned and I am currently looking for another way to track my cross stitch projects. I used to be able to upload my finished picture, from my gallary, in the journal entries and now nothing happens. This saddens me as I usually edit the picture some before I upload it. I have emailed support but not sure if I will hear anything back.

Good, but could be better! Have to get photo credits to add chart photos? No pics for fabrics. Suggestions: Having the ability to change display to small thumbnails rather than list. Group all fabrics by designer....I guess the iOS has some of this, but not everyone uses iOS...Android users deserve better. ðŸ™‚
Love this app but right now can't really use as I need to purchase picture credits. Looking forward to having the same version as the IOS users do.

Mill hill beads are a part of many projects. It would be awesome if we can get Mill Hill beads added in as a category or at least be able to make our own list with just the stock #s. I still can't buy photo credits. ------------------Edit to respond: Thank you!!! Edit: 8/25/2020: I thought you were going to create a pay app like Apple. Still waiting.
replyContent: Hi Holly - we have a lot of request to add Mill Hill tracking and it's definitely on our list of future enhancements.  The photo credit purchase issue is resolved so please try again.

content: Good and useful app. The size of the pic you have in your patterns is tiny though. I wanted to use this as a stitching journal, but you can barely see any details. Why would you want to look at your completed projects as a thumbnail? I am not keen on buying photo credits if that's what I'm paying for.
replyContent: Hello and thanks for your feedback. We added the image zoom feature to the list of possible future enhancements. We already have that feature in X-Stitch Plus for iOS and we're close to releasing X-Stitch Plus for Android which will include image zoom and many other new features.

content: Was working great until I updated it. Now when I try to put a picture with my stitching it just sits and spins. Tried contacting them and got a response. Answered their questions and never heard back from them again. Very frustrating. Got a new phone and tried again and same problem.
replyContent: Hi Jill - we identified the bug that caused the busy indicator to remain visible. Please download the latest version from the Play Store.

content: Brought this thinking it would be good downloaded the app. First couple of times logged in fine. Now wont at all, just says Internet error. Whether on WiFi or data and can be next to the router. All other apps work perfectly.
replyContent: Hi Bridget - sorry you're experiencing problems. Feel free to contact us at support@xstitchapp.com for technical support.

content: Love this app but think the version available on Apple might be even better from other reviews. Please put X-Stitch Plus on Android as it allows multiple photos per chart & mill hill beads etc. Please release the Android Plus version soon! & update to allow us to click on photos & zoom in after saving in xstitch please.
replyContent: Hi Martina - we're making good progress on X-Stitch Plus for Android and hope to release it soon. Thanks for you feedback!

content: Was working great until the start of the new year. Now it crashes and will only let me load one thing at a time.
replyContent: HI Chelsea -please feel free to contact us at support@xstitchapp.com if you have technical issues.

content: Missing several dmc floss colors
replyContent: Hi Jessica - we regularly add new threads and designers. Please email us at support@xstitchapp.com if you have specific requests or to identify any missing items. Also please note that once you add a thread to your inventory, you won't see it on the list to be added again. You can edit the existing item in your inventory, e.g., to change quantity

content: Absolutely love this app! I have as much fun organizing my stash as I do stitching from my stash and this app makes the organizing even more enjoyable. I would love to see a section for beads added since so many of my projects have beads and other embellishments. I recommend this app to everyone that is a cross stitcher.
replyContent: Hi Susan - thanks so much for your feedback!

content: The only way I could love this cross stitch app more would be if you didn't have to buy it for each new device you get. At $2.99, that really isn't bad though, and is totally worth it! The app keeps track of all of your supplies, from your floss, to your fabric, to even your patterns and kits! ðŸ¤— I refer every cross stitcher I know to X-Stitch!! ðŸ˜€ Now if they would work on the issue of having to repurchase this wonderful cross stitch app each time you have a new device, it would be perfect!
replyContent: HI Rebecca - When you go to the Google Play Store on your new device and you're logged in with the same Google account used to purchase the app on your old device, you'll be able to download at no cost. Also, all your app data will be available on your new device - just login with your xstitch account that you used on old device.

content: I really wish the app gave the option to add other floss brands like Cosmo and Presencia. I have some of them and no way to track colors. It would be nice to be able to add designers too ...like say one day I decide to design....or I buy something from a small designer on etsy. might be kind of fun to have a section for LNS stores we have visited, or retreats we have gone to. I like the app though. maybe also be able to look at a chart or kelit we have loaded to see the floss it calls for.
replyContent: HI Tina - thanks for the feedback. We regularly add new floss brands and items. We also take recommendations for new designers. There's also a "Miscellaneous" designer option. Feel free to email us at support@xstitchapp.com with your recommendatons.

content: Decent app, although unfortunately it doesn't have the DMC Mouline Etoile collection at the moment. I hope this app is still being kept up to date and hopefully the Etoile collection of threads is added at some point. Otherwise every other DMC collection is available. I can't comment on other brands as I only use DMC, but there does seem to be a wide range of brands.
when are beads storage going to be added..?
I had trouble logging in to the app, but my problem was addressed promptly. It was my problem and not the app. It's a great app, and I appreciate the quick response to my request for help.
Great app. Would not be able to keep my records straight without it.

Love this app. It has saved me from buying the same chart over and over 
again. The same goes for the threads section. I don't but threads now 
without looking first. Thank you for a very useful app.
Does not work need refund

This ap was a huge disappointment.  I was hoping that you could link the threads/fabric in your stash to specific patterns like you can in stash cache, but you can't.  Save your money and download stash cache.
Great way to keep track of what colours I already have. Will be interesting to see how this app evolves.
I just bought this app, it is not working. I uninstalled it, to add it again, and waz double charged, and the app is still not working. I want a refund

Great app, responsive developer! It has a very complete list of designers, floss, etc. It's easy to keep track of your stash of charts and supplies, and create a shopping list. The dev is incredibly responsive to emailed questions. Love it!
replyContent: Erika - did you email us as requested?  Normally the problem with photos not adding is caused by you not granting permissions to your photos and storage.  Please check your Android Settings and confirm the app has permissions.  If you still have issues, please email us.

content: This is a great app, but you don't have all the designers in the list...I have a list that you don't have..

This is a terrific solution for organizing your threads, fabrics, patterns  and kits.  Perhaps I'm not looking in the right place to find out how to add a thread/manufacturer not currently listed.  I just discovered "miscellaneous" in the designers listing! Is there a similar category for threads?
replyContent: Hi Phillip - thanks for your very kind review!  We don't currently have a miscellaneous option for threads but we regularly add new threads.  You can recommend threads and thread lines by emailing us at support@xstitchapp.com.  We're also looking at potentially adding the ability for users to input their own custom threads.

content: Love this app! The only reason I gave only 4 stars is because I wish it had a beads list.
replyContent: HI Susan - thanks for your kind review!  We plan to add beads and other embellishments in our next major release.

content: Ridiculous that we have to buy photo credits. This app isn't worth this much money. Uninstaller now.
replyContent: Virginia - you can use "Miscellaneous" as the designer if we don't have it listed.  The photo credit cost is there to help offset the cost of storing all your data in the cloud.

content: I like it so far I got this on my Android phone and was wondering can I get it on my Kindle for without having to pay again
replyContent: Hi Jm - thanks for your feedback!  Unfortunately, Amazon devices like the Kindle don't support apps from the Google Play store, so you'll have to purchase it again from the Amazon App Store.  The good news is all your data is automatically available on all your devices without you having to reenter the information.

content: Great have no problems love it best app
replyContent: Louise - thanks for your very kind feedback!

content: Best app for cross stitch inventory!!
replyContent: Thanks Annette!

content: This app is laggy, the edit button on journal entries doesn't work. Pictures don't display most of the time, just loading forever, and can't be updated on WIP entries. Difficult to use, unintuitive user interface. No in app explanation of how to use eg. What is a journal entry supposed to be? What is a photo credit and why do I have to purchase them? Seriously, save your money and just use a spreadsheet.
replyContent: Tash - sorry you weren't able to understand how to use the app.  It's actually quite simple to use.  We store data in the cloud so perhaps your lag issues were caused by poor network connectivity at your location.  Please contact us at our support email (found in settings) and we'd be happy to answer any questions you have.

content: Threads entry onerous and awkward. No way for entering stash threads not on their list, self made threads, etc---basically any thread not commercial & current is out. You want to enter a design using a designer they don't have on their list--No!--won't take the design at all. Foreign (to US) designer? Too bad. Historic design? Tough. Self design? No dice. Ethnic? Sorry. No entry for you! If you are a worker using only current consumer goods might work but awkward & cumbersome otherwise, if useful at all.
replyContent: We have nearly 13,000 threads pre-loaded and we regularly add new thread lines. For charts and linens, we have over 1,200 designers and we add new designers - foreign designers too - every week or so.  Users can request specific designers be added right from the app.

content: I love this app.  But I can't post photos to the journal.  It says I have to purchase photo credits.  When I tried to do that it said unable to complete this action at this time.  I'm very frustrated with this.  This is how I maintain an archive of what I have.  Please fix it.
Working fine now!
replyContent: Hi Shari - Android changed the permissions for storage which caused the photos to not save.  A new version has been released to resolve this issue.  We don't always monitor reviews, so please contact us at support@xstitchapp.com if you have issues.

content: I can't attach pictures. I bought photo credits and can't use them.
replyContent: Hi Thomesha - Android changed the way storage permissions work and that caused the issue.  A new version of X-Stitch is now available to enables photos to work again.  We don't always monitor reviews, so please contact us at support@xstitchapp.com if you have issues.

content: Won't let me add/use any any photos since the last two updates.  I paid for photo credits and can't even use them.
replyContent: Hello - Android changed the way storage permissions work and that caused the issue.  A new version of X-Stitch is now available to enables photos to work again.  We don't always monitor reviews, so please contact us at support@xstitchapp.com if you have issues.

content: Can't download pictures  !!
replyContent: Hello Monica - Android changed the way storage permissions work and that caused the issue.  A new version of X-Stitch is now available to enables photos to work again.  We don't always monitor reviews, so please contact us at support@xstitchapp.com if you have issues.

content: Won't save updates, I have 3 finishes but on the menu it says I have (-1). Won't save my photos but says it uses up my photo tokens. Very disappointed I was looking forward to using this
replyContent: Please contact us at support@xstitchapp.com so we can determine what's going on.

content: Of course I pay for all the images and inputted a lot of items and it keeps saying "invalid session token". I wasted my money and no way to fix. I want a refund!!!!!
replyContent: Hi Rebecca - I believe this issue was resolved for you already, but in case you're still having problems, you can simply log out and back in to fix the session token issue.  This was caused by a backend upgrade we did to improve security.  Thanks.

content: 2nd issue after reinstalled: Doesn't save correctly.  I've made several journal updates.  Says successful- Not.  Tried clossing and going back /*1(Nope. ) [  *It appears the new release after uninstall/ reinstalled has fixed this.  No notification of update.  Had to come in and find. / First issue: Invalid session token.  I just bought space for 100 photos too.  Wont even open - thinking refund if not fixed.  Great before it went down - except that you cant manually add new floss colors or other designers.
replyContent: Hi Kelly - we generally send a push notification after app updates so please confirm your devices allow push notices from the app.  Sorry for the issues you experienced after our backend upgrade.  Please contact us if you're still having problems.  Thanks.

content: Now an "invalid session token" error. :(
replyContent: Hello.  This was caused by a backend upgrade and improved security.  Simply log out and back in to correct.  Thanks.

content: Won't load since update. Says invalid session token.  Uninstalled and reinstalled and works fine.
replyContent: Sorry for the issue Helen.  This was caused by security improvements in our last backend upgrade.  Glad you're back up and running!  Thanks.

content: Won't load since update.  Says invalid session token...

Just started using this app. For the most part it's working well, but there are some issues. I am unable to enter a project unless I choose a designer that is already in the database. This makes it difficult to enter projects of my own design. I'm getting an error on the help page so can't get contact info for developer. Haven't used the thread inventory aspect yet, but it does look comprehensive. Rating may improve after resolution of designer issue.
replyContent: Hi Delana - most folks use the "Miscellaneous" designer or you can recommend we add your designer name too.  Designer recommendations are submitted in the Settings screen.  Thanks.

content: The only question I have is with the shopping  list feature.  Is there a way to edit the quantity of needed skeins for a project.  For instance can I tell the app I need 8 of white.  This would be an improvement.  Also being able to add beads to the lists would really help too
replyContent: Thanks for your suggestions Christine!  We don't currently support editing existing entries but I put this on the list of possible future enhancements.  Beads are a frequent request and we do plan to add that capability.  Thanks.

content: After paying for & using this app for 5 minutes, it crashed! Can't even get a refund-tells me to try again later! What a crock of you-know-what!
replyContent: Refunds are managed by Google, not the developer.  If you send me information about the crash using our support email, I'd be happy to look at the problem.

content: I am very happy this app was recommended to me by a fellow stitcher. This is the 3rd app I have tried for keeping an inventory of my threads, and  can definitely say this is the best one by far.   Figuring out how to save  my entries was not really self-explanatory, but I did figure it out.  Also, when entering your whole inventory, you don't want to select and save them one at a time, so I would select a bunch and then hit the plus sign, which would then give me the save icon. Sometimes while doing this, I would select a bunch and then I guess my finger didn't hit right on the little circle to select  the thread and the app would bypass the plus sign and go right to the save icon. When this happened,  it would only save the last thread I selected; not all of them.  This was a little frustrating, and that's the only reason I didn't give this app 5 stars. Now that all of my threads are entered, this won't be a problem since I won't be entering so many at the same time.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback Debbie!  We'll look at ways to improve the user interface to make it easier to hit the small buttons.

content: I have an android tablet and phone, as well as an iPad. Is it possible to have the app on both android devices?  Great app so far!
replyContent: Yes.  You can load the app on both your Android tablet and phone.  If you purchase the IOS version you can also run it on your iPad.  Since we store your data in the cloud, the data is automatically synchronized between all your devices.

content: I love this app! The ability to keep track of days and photos is great! It would be nice to have the ability to assign threads and fabric to my projects and have it automatically reflect on my inventory and populate my shopping list. Overall though, great app!
replyContent: Thanks Lindsey.  We have your suggestion to assign threads and fabric to projects on our list of possible future enhancements.

content: Not happy gave me no save button so every time l put in info and went out and back in info was gone
replyContent: Mary - I'd be happy to assist.  You can find our support email address in Settings->Help.

content: Really love how this app works. Finally able to have a comprehensive list of my supplies. Would like an option to have a thread in my threads list, but marked as being in a current project. Also, instead of "linen", calling it fabric as other fabrics are used. Can't wait to enter my patterns!
replyContent: Thanks Claire!  We have your suggestions on our list of possible future enhancements.

content: Love to rate this higher, there are missing colors on DMC and not seeing any Dmc silks. Also not seeing anything on app to contact and correct this
replyContent:
Hi Kate - we regularly add new threads.  Just go to Settings->Help to see our contact info.
Jeff

content: Why do the DMC 3000s come in between the 200s and 400s? Please organize color labels the way the stores do. The way it is right now doesn't make logical sense and actually makes it harder to use the app.
replyContent:
Hi Melissa - I updated the sort order in the newest version (1.7).  
Thanks,
Jeff

content: The best xstitch app by far! Have it on my iPhone and now on my android tablet! Thank you!
replyContent: Thanks Anna!  Love to see folks sharing info between IOS and Android.

content: Long waited. Thank you!
replyContent:
Thank you Danute.  We're very happy to finally have the Android version released.

Jeff
